revised_title: Investigation of the Okhta Explosion and Its Effects on Seismographs
tldr: The author investigates the explosion at the Okhta explosives factory and its effects on seismographs. They analyze seismograms and barographs to determine the cause of the explosion and the types of waves involved. The author concludes that the first impulse was a seismic wave, while the second impulse was caused by the air-wave of the explosion. This study highlights the importance of understanding the propagation of explosion waves in the earth and the air.
